#### ZIP-SL-S

**Name:** Symbolic Link Support  
**Expected Behavior:** output "other"  
**Spec Conformity:** n(?)  
**Further Infos:** Does ZIP support soft links? Does the software follow them?
Not specified explicitly, the standard implementation on GNU/Linux supports it.

| :--------- | :-------------------------------- | :------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  | aborted w/ error [^3dbuilder:E06] | aborted              |

| flashprint |                                   | aborted              |
| fusion     |                                   | aborted              |
| ideamaker  |                                   | aborted              |

| zsuite     |                                   | aborted              |

#### ZIP-64

**Name:** ZIP64 Usage  
**Expected Behavior:** Fail  
**Spec Conformity:** y  
**Further Infos:** OPC requires it as a supported extension.

### Denial of Service

Attacks that try to interrupt the availability of the software.

#### DOS-BL-MBR

**Name:** Billion Laughs (Model Build References)  
**Expected Behavior:** Long Execution/Crash  
**Spec Conformity:** y  
**Further Infos:** Something like the billion laughs attack:
Large object, referenced many times in the build (possible with/-out production extension?)
TODO: scale model up (hard to see as its rather small)

| :--------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :-------------------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  | loaded (Bit slower, but after a while redering smooth. Previews of each object didn't load anymore.)                                       | indecisive                        |
| 3dviewer   | loaded (Bit slower, but after a while redering smooth.)                                                                                    | indecisive                        |
| craftware  | loaded partially (loads only one mesh, hence normally fast)                                                                                | loaded (R-SPEC-SE-0)              |
| cura       | loaded w/ warning [^cura:W01] (Loading extremely slow. Warning raised for all objects. Program `Not Responding` after trying to interact.) | aborted                           |
| flashprint | loaded (loads a bit slower. rendering smooth. seems to load all objects, but are combined in one (hence the rendering smoothness))         | loaded (R-PYR-1)                  |
| fusion     | loaded (loads slow, action -> not responding)                                                                                              | loading                           |
| ideamaker  | aborted (crashed)                                                                                                                          | aborted                           |

### Content Spoofing

Attacks that try to present the user fake or modified data.

#### CS-DOR

**Name:** Double Object Reference  
**Expected Behavior:** Output both items  
**Spec Conformity:** y  
**Further Infos:** Same object referenced twice with different transformations.
If transformations are ignored, the two objects should be in the exact same spot
(i.e. they look like one).
  

| Program    | Manual Evaluation                  | Automatic Evaluation |
| :--------- | :--------------------------------- | :------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  | aborted w/ error [^3dbuilder:E01]  | aborted              |
| 3dviewer   |                                    | aborted              |
| craftware  |                                    | aborted              |
| cura       | loaded (graphics broken)           | loaded (R-PYR-1)     |
| flashprint |                                    | aborted              |
| fusion     |                                    | aborted              |
| ideamaker  | aborted (crashed)                  | aborted              |
| lib3mf     |                                    | aborted              |
| lychee     |                                    | loaded nothing       |
| paint3d    |                                    | aborted              |
| prusa      | loaded (pyramid)                   | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| simplify   |                                    | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| slic3r     | aborted (crashed after short hang) | aborted              |
| zsuite     |                                    | indecisive           |

#### Reference Confusion

General attacks to test the behavior of various invalid/weird references.

##### CS-P-NEBS

**Name:** Non-Empty Build Section (Production Extension)  
**Expected Behavior:** Fail  
**Spec Conformity:** n  
**Further Infos:** A build section in secondary model files is required to be empty.
The Cube is referenced invalidly.

| :--------- | :---------------- | :------------------- |

| zsuite     |                   | aborted              |

##### Referenced Object Duplication

Some referenced object/ID is available two times.
The program might choose one or the other, or fail.

###### CS-DOID

**Name:** Double Object ID  
**Expected Behavior:** Fail  
**Spec Conformity:** n  
**Further Infos:** Two objects with the same ID (that is referenced in build, IDs are supposed to be unique).
  

| Program    | Manual Evaluation                 | Automatic Evaluation |
| :--------- | :-------------------------------- | :------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  | aborted w/ error [^3dbuilder:E01] | aborted              |
| 3dviewer   |                                   | aborted              |
| craftware  |                                   | aborted              |
| cura       | loaded (1st)                      | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| flashprint |                                   | aborted              |
| fusion     |                                   | aborted              |
| ideamaker  | loaded (both)                     | loaded (R-SPEC-M-0)  |
| lib3mf     |                                   | aborted              |
| lychee     | loaded (2nd)                      | loaded (R-CYL)       |
| paint3d    |                                   | aborted              |
| prusa      | aborted w/ error [^prusa:E01]     | aborted              |
| simplify   | loaded (2nd)                      | loaded (R-CYL)       |
| slic3r     | loaded (2nd)                      | loaded (R-CYL)       |
| zsuite     | loaded (1st)                      | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |

##### Referenced Object Broken

Attacks where a property (e.g. an XML attribute/element) is referenced that does not exist/is invalid.
The program might ignore the reference, or fail.

##### Model Reference Functionality

Tests that check whether the software respects the `.rels` file in regard to the root 3D model part, or not.
There are two possible files in the compressed folder:
- 3dmodel means a file named `/3D/3dmodel.model`.
- other means a file named `/3D/other.model`.
The title of the testcase indicates whether the file exists and if it is referenced, or not.
The encoding is:
```
E = file exists, R = file is referenced.
0 = statement is false, 1 = statement is true.
```

Hence, `3dmodel: E0 R1` means that the file `/3D/3dmodel.model` does not exist, but is references in in the `.rels` files.

###### CS-0000

**Name:** 3dmodel: E0 R0, other: E0 R0  
**Expected Behavior:** Fail  
**Spec Conformity:** n  
**Further Infos:**   

| Program    | Manual Evaluation                 | Automatic Evaluation |
| :--------- | :-------------------------------- | :------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  | aborted w/ error [^3dbuilder:E03] | aborted              |
| 3dviewer   | aborted w/ error [^3dviewer:E00]  | aborted              |
| craftware  | aborted                           | aborted              |
| cura       | aborted w/ error [^cura:E01]      | aborted              |
| flashprint |                                   | aborted              |
| fusion     |                                   | aborted              |
| ideamaker  |                                   | aborted              |
| lib3mf     |                                   | aborted              |
| lychee     |                                   | aborted              |
| paint3d    |                                   | aborted              |
| prusa      | aborted w/ error [^prusa:E04]     | aborted              |
| simplify   |                                   | aborted              |
| slic3r     | aborted w/ error [^slic3r:E01]    | aborted              |
| zsuite     | aborted                           | aborted              |

#### Property Confusion

Attacks where a property of the model is manipulated so that parsers might react in different ways.

Attacks in this general category have properties that are represented in multiple different places.
These are not always invalid (but might be).
For example, a structure might have an alternative representation and the software chooses one depending on the context (thumbnails, extensions, ...).

##### CS-SE

**Name:** Slicing Extension  
**Expected Behavior:** None  
**Spec Conformity:** y  
**Further Infos:** Different model in the slices as in the faces/triangles definition. [^CS02]
  

| Program    | Manual Evaluation                            | Automatic Evaluation |
| :--------- | :------------------------------------------- | :------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  | loaded (pyramid (slicing cannot be checked)) | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| 3dviewer   |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| craftware  |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| cura       | loaded/sliced (pyramid)                      | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| flashprint |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| fusion     |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| ideamaker  |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| lib3mf     |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| lychee     |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| paint3d    |                                              | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| prusa      | loaded and sliced (pyramid)                  | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| simplify   |                                              | aborted              |
| slic3r     | loaded and sliced (pyramid)                  | loaded (R-PYR-0)     |
| zsuite     |                                              | aborted              |



##### Property Valid

Tests where a property (e.g. an XML attribute/element) of the model is changed to another valid value.
Tests whether this is applied correctly by the program.

##### Property Invalid

Attacks where a property (e.g. an XML attribute/element) of the model is invalid.
The program might ignore or sanitize the property, or fail.

##### Property Duplication

Attacks where a property (e.g. an XML attribute/element) of the model is duplicated in the same place.
The program might choose the first or second, or fail.

###### CS-MUDT

**Name:** Multiple Units different Tags  
**Expected Behavior:** Fail or ignore wrong unittags  
**Spec Conformity:** n  
**Further Infos:** Different unitattributes added to different tags.
Checks which one is taken by parser. Normally only allowed in modeltag.
  

| Program    | Manual Evaluation                                                      | Automatic Evaluation                        |
| :--------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------- | :------------------------------------------ |
| 3dbuilder  | loaded (takes only correct attr. centimeter)                           | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| 3dviewer   |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| craftware  |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| cura       | loaded (takes only correct attr. `centimeter`)                         | loaded (R-PYR-1)                            |
| flashprint |                                                                        | indecisive                                  |
| fusion     |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| ideamaker  |                                                                        | loaded (aplly-scaling-warning-whole-screen) |
| lib3mf     |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| lychee     |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| paint3d    |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| prusa      | loaded w/ warning [^prusa:W02] (takes only correct attr. `centimeter`) | loaded (object-too-large)                   |
| simplify   |                                                                        | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| slic3r     | loaded (seems to ignore unit completely)                               | loaded (R-PYR-0)                            |
| zsuite     |                                                                        | indecisive                                  |

### Data Extraction

Attacks where the file can be used to extract data from the system they are running on.



#### In-Band

The extracted data is contained in the 3MF file itself or the attacker otherwise received direct feedback containing the extracted data.
The attacker can only access it if a 3MF file is returned, or the data from the file is displayed directly (e.g. in the Metadata).
This is mainly relevant for online services (e.g. a Mesh Repair Service).

##### XML-MOD-ALT-FBC-BPR-A

**Name:** ByPass Restrictions Variant A (in .model file; alternative)  
**Expected Behavior:** Ignore DTD or Fail  
**Spec Conformity:** core: Invalid XML  
**Further Infos:**   

| Program    | Manual Evaluation | Automatic Evaluation |
| :--------- | :---------------- | :------------------- |
| 3dbuilder  |                   | aborted              |

#### Out-Of-Band

The extracted data cannot be directly accessed.
The data is send to an attacker-controlled server through a request from the attacked software.
